episodes.title: The Moment I Realized Jehovah’s Witnesses Was a Cult
episodes.description:
At 35 years old, Alyssa Watson a fourth-generation Jehovah’s Witness  realized everything she believed was built on control and fear. In this raw conversation, she describes the moment she and her husband woke up to the truth, the painful decision to leave the organization, and the cost that came with it.

Alyssa opens up about the fear of losing family, being watched by members after leaving, and the courage it took to choose freedom over indoctrination. This is a story of awakening, motherhood, and finding faith beyond manipulation.

episodes.title: I Interviewed Cult Survivors — And I Wasn’t Ready for This
episodes.description: Shelise Ann Sola discusses her takeaways and stories from hosting her hit youtube channel show @CultstoConsciousness

episodes.title: Mormonism to "Cults to Consciousness": Shelise Ann Sola's Story | Worldviews Ep. 47
episodes.description:
In today's episode, we have the honor of speaking with Shelise Sola Ann@CultstoConsciousness a former devout Mormon who has transformed her journey into a powerful platform for healing and awareness. Alongside her husband, Shelise hosts the YouTube channel 'Cults to Consciousness,' where they interview survivors, advocates, and authors who have navigated life after leaving highly controlled environments, including former Mormons, Scientologists, Muslims, and more. 

📖 Growing up in the Mormon faith, Shelisa shares her memories—both good and challenging—as she recounts her process of leaving Mormonism behind. Discover how her experiences shaped her worldview and motivated her to create a safe space for others to share their stories. 

🎤 Shelise also dives into the inception of 'Cults to Consciousness,' discussing some of the most fascinating cult stories and guests that have appeared on the channel. Her passion for helping others is evident in every interview and discussion. 

Join us as we explore Shelise's current worldview and what exciting plans she has for the future of her YouTube channel. Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell to stay updated on our latest content! 

💬 Share your thoughts in the comments below and let us know your favorite moment from this interview! 

#CultsToConsciousness #SurvivorStories #FormerMormon #CultAwareness #personalgrowth

subjects: The Church Of Jesus Christ Of Latter-Day Saints

episodes.title: Interviewing a Former Member of a  Polygamous Cult @beEmboldened | Worldviews Ep.28
episodes.description:
Naomi Wright is the daughter of a pseudo-Christian cult leader and spent 28 years in the arms of the cult. Now she holds a Master's of Science in Social Work and is a licensed mental health professional in the state of Colorado. She also holds a Master of Arts in Christian Studies from Denver Seminary. Her areas of specialty include grief and loss, spiritual abuse, including cult abuse, as well as biblical and theological studies.
